title: SpaceX aces Falcon Heavy launch
summary: Falcon Heavy lived up to its name Friday evening as it launched the heaviest geostationary satellite ever. The 9,200 kg (20,282 lbs)...

title: NASA Mars Ascent Vehicle Continues Progress Toward Mars Sample Return
summary: The first rocket launch from the surface of another planet will be accomplished using two solid rocket motors.

title: Northrop Grumman prepares for final flight of Antares with Russian and Ukrainian components
summary: A Cygnus cargo spacecraft is set to launch to the International Space Station on the final flight of a version of an Antares rocket with Russian and Ukrainian components.

title: KBR wins Air Force Research Lab contract to study non-traditional orbits
summary: KBR, a DoD and NASA contractor, won a $24.9 million contract to provide insights on the behavior of objects in nontraditional orbits.

title: US Senate Cuts Space Force Budget With Defense Bill Approval
summary: The Senate Appropriations Committee (SAC) last week approved an $831 billion defense spending bill for fiscal year 2024 which includes recommendations for approximately $1 billion in cuts from the U.S. Space Force's $30 billion budget request.

title: Europe turns its new $1.5 billion space telescope on, and happily it works
summary: "The spacecraft will soon reach its final position."

title: Redwire Hires Veteran Aerospace Executive as Senior VP
summary: Redwire has appointed veteran aerospace executive G. Allen Flynt as their Senior Vice President of Space Platforms and Robotics.

title: Space Force programs get trimmed in Senate appropriations bill
summary: The Senate Appropriations Committee recommended about $1 billion in cuts from the U.S. Space Force’s $30 billion request.

title: EUCLID Telescope Captures First Images
summary: Months before the long-anticipated Euclid Telescope delivers its groundbreaking view of the cosmos, scientists and engineers involved in the mission are already celebrating a significant milestone as the telescope and instruments have proven to be in excellent working condition.

title: NASA Airs Coverage of Space Station Research, Development Conference
summary: NASA will highlight groundbreaking discoveries, benefits for humanity, and how the agency and its commercial and international partners are maximizing research and development aboard the International Space Station at the 12th annual International Space Station Research and Development Conference.
